instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: hi, macbook air m1, there is no picture on the internal screen, but when I connect it to an external HDMI or UCB C monitor, there are pictures on the second monitor. The board has no signs of damage or water. What could be the problem? All lines on JP600 is ok. Change another scree, flax cable and nothing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
What said the client about how the problem appeared?
Missing both image and backlight?

Check 3V3/<SIGNAL>5V_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>LDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> presence.
Also check if <SIGNAL>1V8_AON</SIGNAL> has the correct voltage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: The device is stuck at 5v, I put a new ROM chip, deleted everything from it and installed a new .bin file through the U301 device. After that I got 20V and the device turned on, but there is no image and backlight. Maybe that's a problem or?
